sen.j: 高槻藩（たかつきはん）は、摂津国に存在した藩の一つ。
sen.e: Takatsuki Domain is one of domains which existed in Settsu Province.
Takatsuki Domain is one of the domains which existed in Settsu Province.
Takatsuki Domain is one of the domains which existed in Settsu Province.

sen.j: 藩庁は高槻城（大阪府高槻市）。
sen.e: The government building of domain was Takatsuki-jo Castle (Takatsuki City, Osaka Prefecture).
The government building of domain was Takatsuki-jo Castle (Takatsuki City, Osaka Prefecture).
The government building of domain was Takatsuki-jo Castle (Takatsuki City, Osaka Prefecture).

sen.j: 高槻は戦国時代 (日本)、織田信長や豊臣秀吉に仕えたキリシタン大名で有名な高山右近が治めていた。
sen.e: Takatsuki was governed by Ukon TAKAYAMA who served Nobunaga ODA and Hideyoshi TOYOTOMI in the Sengoku period (Japan), and who also was well-known for a Christian daimyo (Christian feudal lord).
Takatsuki was governed by Ukon TAKAYAMA who served Nobunaga ODA and Hideyoshi TOYOTOMI in the Sengoku period (Japan), and who also was well-known for a Christian daimyo (Christian feudal lord).
Takatsuki was governed by Ukon TAKAYAMA who served Nobunaga ODA and Hideyoshi TOYOTOMI in the Sengoku period (Japan), and who also was well-known for a Christian daimyo (Christian feudal lord).

sen.j: 右近は秀吉の宣教師追放令で大名の地位を追われ、その後、新庄直頼が3万石で高槻に入ったが、1600年の関ヶ原の戦いで改易され、その身柄は蒲生秀行 (侍従)に預けられた。
sen.e: Ukon was removed his rank of Daimyo by the edict expelling Christian missionaries, afterward, Naoyori SHINJO entered Takatsuki with 30,000 koku, but he was forced to change his rank in the Battle of Sekigahara in 1600, and he was handed over to Hideyuki GAMO (palace staff).

Ukon was removed from his rank of Daimyo by the edict expelling Christian missionaries, afterward, Naoyori SHINJO entered Takatsuki with 30,000 koku, but he was forced to change his rank in the Battle of Sekigahara in 1600, and he was handed over to Hideyuki GAMO (palace staff).

Ukon was removed from his rank of Daimyo by the edict expelling Christian missionaries, afterward, Naoyori SHINJO entered Takatsuki with 30,000 koku, but he was forced to change his rank in the Battle of Sekigahara in 1600, and he was handed over to Hideyuki GAMO (palace staff).

sen.j: 元和 (日本)元年（1615年）内藤信正が近江国長浜藩より4万石で入り高槻藩が立藩した。
sen.e: In 1615, Nobumasa NAITO entered with 40,000 koku from Nagahama domain, Omi Province to establish the Takatsuki Domain.
In 1615, Nobumasa NAITO entered with 40,000 koku from Nagahama domain, Omi Province to establish the Takatsuki Domain.
In 1615, Nobumasa NAITO entered with 40,000 koku from Nagahama domain, Omi Province to establish the Takatsuki Domain.

sen.j: 信正は高槻城を改修し本丸・二の丸を建設した。
sen.e: Nobumasa renovated Takatsuki-jo Castle and constructed Honmaru・Ninomaru.
Nobumasa renovated Takatsuki-jo Castle and constructed Honmaru and Ninomaru.
Nobumasa renovated Takatsuki-jo Castle and constructed Honmaru and Ninomaru.

sen.j: 元和3年（1617年）山城国伏見城となる。
sen.e: It became Fushimi-jo Castle, Yamashiro Province in 1617.
It became Fushimi-jo Castle, Yamashiro Province in 1617.
It became Fushimi-jo Castle, Yamashiro Province in 1617.

sen.j: 下総国守谷市より土岐定義が2万石で入るが、元和5年（1619年）定義が死去。
sen.e: Sadayoshi TOKI entered with 20,000 koku from Moriya City, Shimousa Province, but died in 1619.
Sadayoshi TOKI entered with 20,000 koku from Moriya City, Shimousa Province, but died in 1619.
Sadayoshi TOKI entered with 20,000 koku from Moriya City, Shimousa Province, but died in 1619.

sen.j: 子の土岐頼行は幼少のため、減封により1万石にて下総国守谷に再び移封となった。
sen.e: His child, Yoriyuki TOKI, was still so young, so was forced to return to Moriya City, Shimousa Province with 10,000 koku, a diminished territory.
His child, Yoriyuki TOKI, was still so young, so was forced to return to Moriya City, Shimousa Province with 10,000 koku, a diminished territory.
His child, Yoriyuki TOKI, was still so young, so was forced to return to Moriya City, Shimousa Province with 10,000 koku, a diminished territory.

sen.j: 三河国形原より松平家信が2万石で入るが、寛永12年（1635年）下総佐倉藩へ移封。
sen.e: Ienobu MATSUDAIRA entered with 20,000 koku from Katahara, Mikawa Province, but transferred to Sakura domain, Shimousa.
Ienobu MATSUDAIRA entered with 20,000 koku from Katahara, Mikawa Province, but transferred to Sakura domain, Shimousa.
Ienobu MATSUDAIRA entered with 20,000 koku from Katahara, Mikawa Province, but transferred to Sakura domain, Shimousa.

sen.j: 播磨国龍野藩より岡部宣勝が5万1千石で入ったが、寛永17年（1640年）和泉国岸和田藩へ移封。
sen.e: Nobukatsu OKABE entered with 51,000 koku from Tatsuno domain of the Province of Harima, but transferred to Kishiwada Domain in Izumi province in 1640.
Nobukatsu OKABE entered with 51,000 koku from Tatsuno domain, Harima Province, but was transferred to Kishiwada Domain, Izumi Province in 1640.
sen.cmt: Provinceの書き方を統一しました。
sen.e: Nobukatsu OKABE entered with 51,000 koku from Tatsuno domain, Harima Province, but was transferred to Kishiwada Domain, Izumi Province in 1640.

sen.j: 下総佐倉藩より家信の次男・松平康信が3万6,000石で入るが、慶安2年（1649年）丹波国篠山藩へ移封と、藩主が短期間で相次いで変わり、藩主家の交替が相次いだ。
sen.e: Yasunobu MATSUDAIRA, the second son of Ienobu, entered with 36,000 koku from Sakura domain, Shimousa, but transferred to Sasayama Domain, Tanba Province in 1649, thus, the domain lord successively changed in short term, which also caused the successive replacement of the family of lord of the domain.

Yasunobu MATSUDAIRA, the second son of Ienobu, entered with 36,000 koku from Sakura domain, Shimousa, but transferred to Sasayama Domain, Tanba Province in 1649, thus, the domain lord successively changed in short term, which also caused the successive replacement of the family of lord of the domain.

Yasunobu MATSUDAIRA, the second son of Ienobu, entered with 36,000 koku from Sakura domain, Shimousa, but transferred to Sasayama Domain, Tanba Province in 1649, thus, the domain lord successively changed in short term, which also caused the successive replacement of the family of lord of the domain.

sen.j: その後、山城国長岡藩 (山城国)より永井直清が3万6,000石で入ってようやく藩主が定着し、以後、永井氏13代の支配で明治時代を迎えた。
sen.e: After that, the entrance of Naokiyo NAGAI with 36,000 koku from Nagaoka domain, Yamashiro Province finally brought a settlement to the domain lord, afterward, Meiji Period came during the 13th Nagai clan's governance.

After that, the entrance of Naokiyo NAGAI with 36,000 koku from Nagaoka domain, Yamashiro Province finally brought a settlement to the domain lord, afterward, Meiji Period came during the 13th Nagai clan's governance.
sen.cmt: アポストロフィ、全角です。
sen.e: After that, the entrance of Naokiyo NAGAI with 36,000 koku from Nagaoka domain, Yamashiro Province finally brought a settlement to the domain lord, afterward, Meiji Period came during the 13th Nagai clan's governance.

sen.j: 明治4年（1871年）廃藩置県により高槻県となり、のち大阪府に編入された。
sen.e: It turned to be Takatsuki Prefecture in 1871 by Haihan-chiken (abolition of feudal domains and establishment of prefectures), and it was later incorporated into Osaka Prefecture.
It turned to be Takatsuki Prefecture in 1871 by Haihan-chiken (abolition of feudal domains and establishment of prefectures), and it was later incorporated into Osaka Prefecture.

sen.j: 長浜藩（ながはまはん）は江戸時代初期、近江国坂田郡周辺を領有した譜代大名の藩。
sen.e: Nagahama Domain was the domain belonged to Fudai daimyo who possessed the nearby spots of Sakata-gun, Omi Province in the early Edo period.

sen.j: 藩庁は長浜城 (近江国)（滋賀県長浜市）に置かれた。
sen.e: The government building of domain was set up at the Nagahama Castle (Omi province) (Nagahama City, Shiga Prefecture).

sen.j: 慶長11年（1606年）駿河国駿府藩4万石の内藤信成が4万石を与えられ、豊臣氏の動静を監視するため転封し立藩した。
sen.e: In 1606, Nobunari NAITO with 40,000 koku in the domain of Sunpu in Suruga Province transferred to another territory to watch Toyotomi clan's movements provided with 40,000 koku, and established the domain.

sen.cmt: アポストロフィ、全角です。
sen.e: In 1606, Nobunari NAITO with 40,000 koku in the domain of Sunpu in Suruga Province transferred to another territory to watch Toyotomi clan's movements provided with 40,000 koku, and established the domain.

sen.j: なお転封にあたり、長浜城の修築費として江戸幕府より白銀5千枚を与えられた。
sen.e: At the time of changing the territory, he was provided with 5,000 pieces of hakugin (white silver) by Edo bakufu for the repair cost of Nagahama-jo Castle.

sen.e: Nobumasa NAITO, the oldest son of Nobunari, transferred to Takatsuki domain in Settsu Province which was closer to Osaka, so the original domain was abolished.

sen.e: The jinya (regional government office) was run in Nagaoka (Nagaokakyo City, Kyoto Prefecture) as government building of domain.
The jinya (regional government office) was run in Nagaoka (Nagaokakyo City, Kyoto Prefecture) as government building of domain.
The jinya (regional government office) was run in Nagaoka (Nagaokakyo City, Kyoto Prefecture) as government building of domain.

sen.j: 寛永10年（1633年）書院番で上総国・下総国内に8千石を領する旗本の永井直清が、旧領地に加え山城国、紀伊国、摂津国内に領地を得て、1万2千石の大名に昇格した。
sen.e: In 1633, Naokiyo NAGAI who was a shoinban (the castle guard) and a hatamoto with 8,000 koku in his possession within Kazusa Province and Shimousa Province gained another territory in Yamashiro Province, Kii Province, and Settsu Province in addition to his original territory to be promoted to Daimyo with 12,000 koku.

In 1633, Naokiyo NAGAI who was a shoinban (the castle guard) and a hatamoto with 8,000 koku in his possession within Kazusa Province and Shimousa Province gained another territory in Yamashiro Province, Kii Province, and Settsu Province in addition to his original territory to be promoted to Daimyo with 12,000 koku.

In 1633, Naokiyo NAGAI who was a shoinban (the castle guard) and a hatamoto with 8,000 koku in his possession within Kazusa Province and Shimousa Province gained another territory in Yamashiro Province, Kii Province, and Settsu Province in addition to his original territory to be promoted to Daimyo with 12,000 koku.

sen.j: 当初、長岡勝龍寺城に居所を構え、のち長岡神足寺に移った。
sen.e: He initially set his place in Shoryuji Castle in Nagaoka, and later moved into Kotari-ji Temple in Nagaoka.
sen.cmt: Webで調べたところ、長岡の神足は「こうたり」と読むそうですが、「神足寺」もそうであるかは不明です。
sen.e: He initially set his place in Shoryuji Castle in Nagaoka, and later moved into Kotari-ji Temple in Nagaoka.
He initially set his place in Shoryuji Castle in Nagaoka, and later moved into Kotari-ji Temple in Nagaoka.

sen.j: 昇格と同時に書院番頭となった。
sen.e: He bacame Head of military patrol on his promotion.
He bacame Head of military patrol on his promotion.
He bacame Head of military patrol on his promotion.

sen.j: 慶安2年（1649年）2万4千石の加増を受け高槻藩に転封となったため、当藩は廃藩となった。
sen.e: In 1649, he transferred to Takatsuki domain provided with another 24,000 koku, so the original domain was abolished.
In 1649, he transferred to Takatsuki domain provided with another 24,000 koku, so the original domain was abolished.
In 1649, he transferred to Takatsuki domain provided with another 24,000 koku, so the original domain was abolished.
